items.text:
# Instructions

Reverse a string

For example:
input: "cool"
output: "looc"

####

Use the above instructions to modify the supplied files: reverse_string.py
Keep and implement the existing function or class stubs, they will be called from unit tests.
Do not implement or change any unit tests.
Only use standard python libraries, don't suggest installing any packages.

Explanation:
In the reverse function, we use slicing to get the characters of the input string in reverse order. The [::-1] syntax tells Python to start at the end of the string and move backwards to the beginning, stepping backwards by 1 character each time. This creates a new string with the characters in reverse order, which is then returned as the result of the function.
I updated the existing file.
